title: Disclosure of top 10 vulnerability types for programs that haven't enabled the Insights feature

profile.name: HackerOne
profile.about: Vulnerability disclosure should be safe, transparent, and rewarding.

vulnerability_information:
## Summary

Although the report count is not showing, the Insights query endpoint returns a list of top 10 vulnerability types for any programs that haven't enabled the Insights feature.

## Reproduction

1. Go to a program that has Insights feature enabled, e.g: https://hackerone.com/security/insights
2. Go to the Burp HTTP History, and then repeat the second ```(POST) /grapql``` request, see the following image:
██████████
3. Change the ```handle_0``` parameter to a program that haven't enabled the Insights feature (no Insights tab on the program page), e.g: ██████.

Request:

```
POST /graphql HTTP/1.1
Host: hackerone.com
User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; Win64; x64; rv:61.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/61.0
Accept: */*
Accept-Language: en-US,en;q=0.5
Accept-Encoding: gzip, deflate
Referer: https://hackerone.com/security/insights
content-type: application/json
x-auth-token: ...
origin: https://hackerone.com
Content-Length: 1939
Cookie: ...
Connection: close

{"query":"query Insights($handle_0:String!,$last_1:Int!,$first_2:Int!,$first_3:Int!,$state_4:TeamWeaknessStates!) {
  team(handle:$handle_0) {
    id,
    ...F0
  }
}
fragment F0 on Team {
  name,
  offers_bounties,
  hide_bounty_amounts,
  _profile_metrics_snapshots34WPw7:profile_metrics_snapshots(last:$last_1) {
    edges {
      node {
        id,
        month,
        year,
        bounties_count,
        bounties_paid
      },
      cursor
    },
    pageInfo {
      hasNextPage,
      hasPreviousPage
    }
  },
  team_profile {
    latest_report_created_at,
    reports_received_in_three_months_count,
    latest_serious_report_created_at,
    disclosed_reports_in_last_year_count,
    hackers_invited_all_time_count,
    hackers_accepted_all_time_count,
    recently_participating_hackers_count,
    id
  },
  _structured_scopes2uadQf:structured_scopes(eligible_for_submission:true,first:$first_2) {
    edges {
      node {
        asset_identifier,
        eligible_for_submission,
        low_severity_resolved_reports_count,
        medium_severity_resolved_reports_count,
        high_severity_resolved_reports_count,
        critical_severity_resolved_reports_count,
        id
      },
      cursor
    },
    pageInfo {
      hasNextPage,
      hasPreviousPage
    }
  },
  team_display_options {
    show_reports_resolved,
    show_total_bounties_paid,
    show_average_bounty,
    id
  },
  _team_weaknessesE63B6:team_weaknesses(first:$first_3,state:$state_4,with_reports:true) {
    edges {
      node {
        id,
        weakness {
          name,
          external_id,
          id
        },
        report_count,
        state
      },
      cursor
    },
    pageInfo {
      hasNextPage,
      hasPreviousPage
    }
  },
  id
}","variables":{"handle_0":"███","last_1":3,"first_2":100,"first_3":10,"state_4":"enabled"}}
```

Response:

```
HTTP/1.1 200 OK
Date: Sun, 19 Aug 2018 12:24:05 GMT
Content-Type: application/json; charset=utf-8
Connection: close
Cache-Control: no-cache, no-store
Content-Disposition: inline; filename="response."
X-Request-Id: 1af97dec-6e22-40c2-8483-16c4ee717d0e
Set-Cookie: ...
Strict-Transport-Security: max-age=31536000; includeSubDomains; preload
Expect-CT: enforce, max-age=86400
Content-Security-Policy: default-src 'none'; base-uri 'self'; child-src www.youtube-nocookie.com b5s.hackerone-ext-content.com; connect-src 'self' www.google-analytics.com errors.hackerone.net; font-src 'self'; form-action 'self'; frame-ancestors 'none'; img-src 'self' data: cover-photos.hackerone-user-content.com hackathon-photos.hackerone-user-content.com profile-photos.hackerone-user-content.com hackerone-us-west-2-production-attachments.s3-us-west-2.amazonaws.com; media-src 'self' hackerone-us-west-2-production-attachments.s3-us-west-2.amazonaws.com; script-src 'self' www.google-analytics.com; style-src 'self' 'unsafe-inline'; report-uri https://errors.hackerone.net/api/30/csp-report/?sentry_key=61c1e2f50d21487c97a071737701f598
Referrer-Policy: strict-origin-when-cross-origin
X-Content-Type-Options: nosniff
X-Download-Options: noopen
X-Frame-Options: DENY
X-Permitted-Cross-Domain-Policies: none
X-XSS-Protection: 1; mode=block
Server: cloudflare
CF-RAY: 44cc98517fe13415-HKG
Content-Length: 4736

██████████
```

Search for ```_team_weaknessesE63B6``` to see the list of top 10 vulnerability types:
{F335292}

### █████ top 10:

- Cross-site Scripting (XSS) - Stored
- Cross-site Scripting (XSS) - Reflected
- Improper Authentication - Generic
- Information Disclosure
- Server-Side Request Forgery (SSRF)
- Insecure Direct Object Reference (IDOR)
- Cross-site Scripting (XSS) - Generic
- XML External Entities (XXE)
- Open Redirect
- Privacy Violation

## Impact

Disclosure of top 10 vulnerability types for programs that haven't enabled the Insights feature

activities.message:
## More findings - 2

Similar to the last finding, the 'Top 10 Vulnerabilities' of the program insights actually shows the weakness list based on:

```
for weakness in list_of_weaknesses:
    if report_count(weakness) > 0 AND report_date(weakness) >= last_90_days:
        report_90_days[weakness] += 1 ;

top10 = report_90_days(top_10, desc)
```

We can manipulate the ```first_3``` parameter of the endpoint to list all (90 days) submission counts. For example, ```██████``` returns 13 weaknesses (including +1 hidden weakness) if we change the parameter to ```"first_3":20```:

Request:

```
POST /graphql HTTP/1.1
Host: hackerone.com
User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; Win64; x64; rv:61.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/61.0
Accept: */*
Accept-Language: en-US,en;q=0.5
Accept-Encoding: gzip, deflate
Referer: https://hackerone.com/uploadcare/insights
content-type: application/json
x-auth-token: ...
origin: https://hackerone.com
Content-Length: 1935
Cookie: ...
Connection: close

{"query":"query Insights($handle_0:String!,$last_1:Int!,$first_2:Int!,$first_3:Int!,$state_4:TeamWeaknessStates!) {
  team(handle:$handle_0) {
    id,
    ...F0
  }
}
fragment F0 on Team {
  name,
  offers_bounties,
  hide_bounty_amounts,
  _profile_metrics_snapshots34WPw7:profile_metrics_snapshots(last:$last_1) {
    edges {
      node {
        id,
        month,
        year,
        bounties_count,
        bounties_paid
      },
      cursor
    },
    pageInfo {
      hasNextPage,
      hasPreviousPage
    }
  },
  team_profile {
    latest_report_created_at,
    reports_received_in_three_months_count,
    latest_serious_report_created_at,
    disclosed_reports_in_last_year_count,
    hackers_invited_all_time_count,
    hackers_accepted_all_time_count,
    recently_participating_hackers_count,
    id
  },
  _structured_scopes2uadQf:structured_scopes(eligible_for_submission:true,first:$first_2) {
    edges {
      node {
        asset_identifier,
        eligible_for_submission,
        low_severity_resolved_reports_count,
        medium_severity_resolved_reports_count,
        high_severity_resolved_reports_count,
        critical_severity_resolved_reports_count,
        id
      },
      cursor
    },
    pageInfo {
      hasNextPage,
      hasPreviousPage
    }
  },
  team_display_options {
    show_reports_resolved,
    show_total_bounties_paid,
    show_average_bounty,
    id
  },
  _team_weaknessesE63B6:team_weaknesses(first:$first_3,state:$state_4,with_reports:true) {
    edges {
      node {
        id,
        weakness {
          name,
          external_id,
          id
        },
        report_count,
        state
      },
      cursor
    },
    pageInfo {
      hasNextPage,
      hasPreviousPage
    }
  },
  id
}","variables":{"handle_0":"██████","last_1":7,"first_2":100,"first_3":20,"state_4":"enabled"}}
```

Response:

```
HTTP/1.1 200 OK
Date: Wed, 22 Aug 2018 08:20:49 GMT
Content-Type: application/json; charset=utf-8
Connection: close
Cache-Control: no-cache, no-store
Content-Disposition: inline; filename="response."
X-Request-Id: af52fc5f-2b5d-46f5-9005-05a37858deac
Set-Cookie: ...

Server: cloudflare

██████████

Search for ```_team_weaknessesE63B6``` to see the result:

### ██████ weaknesses:

1. Information Disclosure
2. Cross-site Scripting (XSS) - Reflected
3. Cross-site Scripting (XSS) - Stored
4. Cross-site Scripting (XSS) - DOM
5. Open Redirect
6. Cross-site Scripting (XSS) - Generic
7. Business Logic Errors
8. Code Injection
9. Server-Side Request Forgery (SSRF)
10. SQL Injection
11. Denial of Service
12. Improper Authentication - Generic

Request for the hidden weaknesses by changing the ```state_4``` parameter to ```"state_4":"hidden"```

Request:

```

### ████████ hidden weakness:

1. Externally Controlled Reference to a Resource in Another Sphere

Hi @tolo7010 -

Thanks for reporting to us! We have evaluated your report, and here's our responses:

**Re: Exposing paid bounties statistics for more than 3 months**
We recognize this behavior and do not see a feasible attack scenario, and thus do not consider it a vulnerability. For example, you could have started monitoring the data since today and over time you'd be able to aggregate all historical data.  

**Re: Exposing a sorted list based on resolved report count per weakness, when Insights if OFF for the program**
We have verified that the list will indeed sort by resolved report count regardless if the feature is ON or OFF.
However, the information exposed here is of relative small risk: 1) whether or not a weakness has any resolved report, and 2) whether a weakness has more resolved report count than another, and 3) potentially the trend of their resolved report count over time. Note that we do not disclose the exact count, nor the reports themselves. Therefore, we consider it a minor issue.

That being said, we appreciate your thoughtful reporting, and agree with you that for best practices we should fix this. We've triaged this to our engineering team, and will get back to you when there's an update. 

Thanks,
Pei
Thanks for the find! We're currently working on a fix, and will update you once it's done.

Thanks for the bounty! and hope the bug will be fixed soon. Please let me know if you need more information.

Regards,
tolo7010
Hi @tolo7010 - this should be fixed now. Thanks again for bringing this to our attention, it's much appreciated!

Hi @jobert and team,

Great work!
It looks like there are many hackers interested in this report as we can see from the vote count. So I would like to request public disclosure to empower our community. While this is a low severity bug, this may be a good read to new hackers.

Please consider reacting the following strings/components as they may refer to some private programs:
- Attached images.
- "████████"
- "██████"

Thank you for creating this community and I hope to work with you again in future reports.

Regards,
tolo7010

Hi,

After resolved this report, I noticed that we can get a scope that was not specified in the program rules, for example █████ ████████ and ███ █████

Is it normal behavior?

I reported this earlier here #403615
Hi @ragnar - sorry for the delay in getting back to you. Yes, that is expected. Archived scopes are accessible by anyone who has access to the program. Thanks for checking!
